data.title: Fixed and improved xorshift128+ implementation.
Gdx.app.log() doesn't work on iOS(robovm)
data.body:
I call this in my `render`:

```
Gdx.app.log("width", Gdx.graphics.getWidth.toString())
```

But when I run the compiled app in iOS simulator, the it doesn't write anything in my console.

Console log:

```
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw SimulatorBridge[63321] <Warning>:   LaunchServices: installing app for existing placeholder LSApplicationProxy: retinol
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw SimulatorBridge[63321] <Warning>:   LaunchServices: Not creating progress for LSApplicationProxy: retinol since it is not a placeholder.
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw installd[63326] <Notice>: 0xb0115000 handle_install_for_ls: Install of "/Users/raincole/games/retinol/ios/target/native/Retinol.app" requested by SimulatorBridge
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw installd[63326] <Notice>: 0xb0115000 MobileInstallationInstall_Server: Installing app retinol
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw installd[63326] <Notice>: 0xb0115000 install_application: Performing developer delta patch
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw installd[63326] <Notice>: 0xb0115000 MobileInstallationInstall_Server: Staging: 0.11s; Waiting: 0.00s; Installation: 0.03s; LS Sync: 0.00s; Overall: 0.14s
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw lsd[63339] <Warning>: LaunchServices: Updating identifier store
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw SpringBoard[63330] <Error>: libMobileGestalt MobileGestalt.c:835: still-camera is static and will never generate a notification
Jul 15 06:44:22 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw SpringBoard[63330] <Error>: libMobileGestalt MobileGestalt.c:835: stand-alone-contacts is static and will never generate a notification
Jul 15 06:44:23 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw SpringBoard[63330] <Warning>: LICreateIconForImage passed NULL CGImageRef image
Jul 15 06:44:23 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw SimulatorBridge[63321] <Warning>: Application launched after 0.00 seconds.
Jul 15 06:44:24 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw backboardd[63322] <Error>: HID: The 'Passive' connection 'Retinol' access to protected services is denied.
Jul 15 06:45:45 tamacat.m8.ntu.edu.tw SpringBoard[63330] <Warning>: Received memory warning.
```

data.title: JNI Crash
data.body:
When my app is making meshes it crashes after the first few times. I noticed that the stack traces on android and PC are different however they are both in

```
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.BufferUtils
```

I don't think it is a memory issue seeing as on the PC it goes up to about 800mb and then crashes and I have 2GB allocated using:

```
-Xmx2G -Xms2G
```

[Link to android and desktop crashes](https://gist.github.com/ictrobot/f4d4c6c21853060ea30f)

data.title: Added missing Decal.setRotation method.
Support for loading BitmapFonts from TextureAtlases
data.body:
I haven't actually tested this yet, I'm in the process of doing that, but I wanted to get some feedback first.

Anyway, isn't it weird that `BitmapFont`s can be created from `TextureRegion`s, but you can't do so within a `BitmapFontLoader`?  Being able to do so would be really, really convenient.  Putting your fonts in the same atlas as your sprites would improve performance, and this PR makes it easier to do so.

An update to the `BitmapFontTest` is on the way.

data.title: Small JavaDoc corrections.
data.body: http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/nightlies/docs/api/com/badlogic/gdx/Input.html#getRotationMatrix-float:A- links to http://developer.android.com/reference/android/hardware/SensorManager.html#getRotationMatrix%28float[],%20float[],%20float[],%20float[]%29 which describes the axes a bit different than our JavaDoc.

data.title: Robovm iOS   real device fullscreen (hided status bar )returns  incorrect touch coordinates
data.body: On real iOS devices ex iPhone 5 with screen resolution 640x1136 in my app I got touch values returned from range 1-620 (app fullscreen) it happens also on iPads and touches range is alway smaller about 20-40 pixels. When statusbar is showed everything looks ok. I have checked on my project, demo-invaders and default app on Libgdx 1.0 and 1.2 Robovm 0.11 and 0.14 . On simulator everythink is OK

data.title: iOS  real device fullscreen (hided status bar )returns  incorrect touch coordinates
data.body:
On real iOS devices ex iPhone 5 with screen resolution 640x1136 in my app I got touch values returned from range 1-620 (app fullscreen) it happens also on iPads and touches range is alway smaller about 20-40 pixels. When statusbar is showed everything looks ok. I have checked on my project and also on demo-invaders and defalut gdx app on Libgdx 1.0 and 1.2 Robovm 0.11 and 0.14 . On simulator raported touch coordinates are OK.

Edit: the range of touches is 0 - 620  !!!

Dialog can be shown or hidden with custom action
data.body: User can pass custom action to show and hide methods, but old non parametric methods will use default fade action.

data.title: Quaternion.getPitch() returns NaN
data.body:
Here is the sample : 
A rotation from a g3dj file : [0.000000, -0.707107,  0.707107,  0.000000]

The getPtich works only on normalized quat, but the nor() , due to tolerance, does not needs to normalize it.
The getPitch does asin(1.0000006) so NaN is returned.

Maybe the tolerance needs to be avoided, or the getPitch use a normalization more precise.

Thanks !

data.title: Sound effect auto-dispose upon finish
data.body: I've run into an issue where I am playing a sound effect as part of the transition from one Scene to another, but I am having trouble disposing of it in a timely manner (I'm disposing the asset when the new Scene transitions). I propose adding in either a OnCompletionListener (like in the Music class) or a method such as "playAndDispose" which will dispose the asset once it has finished playing. I have looked and there does not seem to be an obvious solution to my problem, other than creating some kinda of LRU cache to the openal resource which will dispose the oldest sound when full, but this might not also not happen in a timely manner (that way I won't have to worry about disposing it in another Scene, it will be done automatically at some point).

data.title: Bullet paths too long for windows
data.body:
Some of the file paths are very long and can cause problems on Windows if working a few directories in.
For example:
C:\Users<username>\Documents\libgdx\master\extensions\gdx-bullet\jni\swig-src\collision\com\badlogic\gdx\physics\bullet\collision\SWIGTYPE_p_f_r_btManifoldPoint_p_q_const__btCollisionObjectWrapper_int_int_p_q_const__btCollisionObjectWrapper_int_int__bool.java

data.title: DepthShader and transparent textures
data.body:
The default DepthShader doesn't support transparent textures, which despite beeing marked as a `TODO` in-code since the creation of the class hasn't been addressed yet. Neither are workarounds available, at least after so much thorough research on my end.

If this can't be fixed, due to different reasons like minor importance of the issue, can you please offer a workaround solution, that'd be really great.

data.title: Pool.free should do nothing if the object is already in the pool
AndroidApplication, hideStatusBar
data.body:
Show status bar before hiding need only for Android 3.x.
Otherwise screen can lag (twitch) if hideStatusBar called while app is running on some devices (e.g. Nexus series).

data.title: AssetManager: BitmapFontLoader does not support fonts that exist as atlased regions within textures
data.body:
I'm trying to write an AssetLoader which can load a BitmapFont using a specified TextureRegion from a TextureAtlas, however there does not seem to be any support for this type of operation, i.e., this is a feature that should be included within the BitmapFontLoader. Aside from implementing that ability, another simpler proposed change that could be made with the AssetManager would be to allow "putting" of custom assets with a K-V pair. This would allow for the creation of the custom "atlased" font, and then putting it under its appropriate font path key for use. Obviously adding the put function would sacrifice some data safety (people unfamiliar with the API could corrupt their assets with incorrectly loaded and then cached data), but this should be the easier fix.

Of course, another solution again would be to create a new AtlasedBitmapFont class which would essentially be a BitmapFont with a reference to a TextureAtlas with each region representing various font sizes (which is exactly what I am doing). This would forego the issues with the BitmapFontLoader and delegate those responsibilities to the AtlasedBitmapFont and AtlasedBitmapFontLoader classes.

data.title: Sprites & Sprite Fonts glitches on resume (context loss?)
quick fix for scene2d debug memory leak
data.body:
fixes #2013

I just removed the app check. I'm not sure when one would want to debug multiple apps or how that would be possible, but maybe @NathanSweet knows something I don't.

Now it is just a lazy initialization.

data.title: Checkable Buttons' labels require pressed offset fields
data.body: I'm just starting out with LibGDX so I may be doing this incorrectly, but I am using TextButton to represent a collection of Button objects within a ButtonGroup, and while the pressed offset works when selecting the button, it is nonexistent for the actual checked button stage itself. Visually the text offsets correctly when pressing, and then returns to the standard unpressed position in spite of a visually pressed button. I'll post images if what I have said is unclear. My proposed change should be simple, either apply the pressed offset while in the checked state, or add a new checked offset for when the item is checked. Personally, I don't understand why there is a "checked" drawable in the first place, checked should just imply that the button is in its "down" state (unless by "down" you mean "selecting", in which case "checked" should just be "selected" or the like).

data.title: Lwjgl backend doesn't support OpenGL ES 3.2+
data.body:
Creating a LwjglApplication with useGL30 set to true still doesn't create an OpenGL ES 3 context. Additionally, Gdx.gl30 is null.

The issue seems to be [here](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl/LwjglGraphics.java#L166). context should be passed in to Display.create along with the PixelFormat.

[This line](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl/LwjglGraphics.java#L241) should also check whether the major version is 3 and set gl30 accordingly.

data.body: I am still using Cell's ignore and not I am not alone. Please add it back.
